unnormalised: **Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches in India**
normalised: **Automotive News: Understanding Recent Vehicle Launches in India**

unnormalised: Recent months have seen a flurry of vehicle launches in India, offering consumers diverse options across various segments. Dr. Rajesh Sharma, Automotive Engineering Professor at IIT-Madras, explains that many launches are focused on improving fuel efficiency and reducing emissions, aligning with Bharat Stage VI (BSVI) norms.
normalised: Recent months have seen a flurry of vehicle launches in India, offering consumers diverse options across various segments. Doctor Rajesh Sharma, Automotive Engineering Professor at I I T-Madras, explains that many launches are focused on improving fuel efficiency and reducing emissions, aligning with Bharat Stage six (B S V I) norms.

unnormalised: Tata Motors recently unveiled its new compact SUV, promising a mileage of 25 kmpl. Mahindra & Mahindra launched an updated version of its popular Scorpio, boasting improved safety features and a more spacious interior. These launches reflect the increasing demand for SUVs among Indian families.
normalised: Tata Motors recently unveiled its new compact S U V, promising a mileage of twenty five kilometer per liter. Mahindra and Mahindra launched an updated version of its popular Scorpio, boasting improved safety features and a more spacious interior. These launches reflect the increasing demand for S U Vs among Indian families.

unnormalised: Experts note a growing trend towards electric vehicles (EVs). Several manufacturers, including Maruti Suzuki and Hyundai, have announced plans to launch new EV models in the coming year. Government incentives and a push for sustainable mobility are driving this shift.
normalised: Experts note a growing trend towards electric vehicles (E V s). Several manufacturers, including Maruti Suzuki and Hyundai, have announced plans to launch new E V models in the coming year. Government incentives and a push for sustainable mobility are driving this shift.

unnormalised: Consumers should carefully compare specifications and features before making a purchase. Factors like fuel efficiency, maintenance costs (Rs. per year), and safety ratings are crucial. Remember to consider the boot space (measured in liters) and total area of the showroom (measured in sq ft) for an informed decision. Happy driving!
normalised: Consumers should carefully compare specifications and features before making a purchase. Factors like fuel efficiency, maintenance costs (rupees per year), and safety ratings are crucial. Remember to consider the boot space (measured in liters) and total area of the showroom (measured in square feet) for an informed decision. Happy driving!
